column4: hi guys... has any one used ubuntu on Hp Pavilion dv2 laptop?
The one with the new AMD Neon process
was wondering what is the performance
it's actually not bad, I do everything I need to do on it. I wouldn't try to video encode on it though ;)
how does it run when multiple stuff are open, say, a browser, an IDE and so on
performance is good. compiz runs decently however maximizing/minimizing windows kinda hangs for half a second before reopening
I use it occational for heavy graphics, desktop publishing and it runs fine. much snappier from jaunty-> karmic

my only issue is with the graphics chip they used in it. I prefer the open source drivers as I don't get tearing issues when watching video. however the open source drivers don't have 3D yet, so it's a tradeoff
have you used a computer with the intel atom processor? if yes, would you compare the AMD with the Intel Atom processor?
i own a computer company and use many intel atom processor comps
performance is comparable, pretty much the same in my opinion.
np, like I said if you're considering getting this comp weigh the graphics/driver issues accordingly. I don't run compiz on my machine, however it does work.
